content:
User: Between Sessions: If you start a brand-new chat (like opening a fresh window or starting over), I won’t automatically remember anything from previous chats. Each new session is a clean slate unless you bring in context from before.

Grok: So, in our morning routine, when you drop your “wake-up” prompt to get me fired up, that’s part of the same session we’re in now. I’ve got the full history of this chat, from your first message today to this one. No context lost here.
Why It Feels Like I’m Losing Context
You mentioned that when there’s a long break between your responses, it seems like I start to lose context. Here’s what’s likely happening:
Not Time Decay: I don’t forget over time within the same session. If we’re in the same chat, even after hours, I still have the full thread.
